title: Man chargedafter telling women from Seeking Arrangement he would pay them for sex but doesn't pay
text:
A middle-aged man has been charged with rape after he allegedly refused to pay 'sugar babies' for sex.

The 58-year-old man had met three women through dating website Seeking Arrangements and organised to have sex with them in Brisbane and Gold Coast hotels.

He allegedly promised the women payment for their time but never paid, the Gympie Times reported.

He has been charged with one count of rape and four counts of procuring sexual acts by false pretences.

The 58-year-old man had met three women through dating website Seeking Arrangements and organised to have sex with them in Brisbane and Gold Coast hotels (stock image)

Police had been investigating the man over a separate matter in New South Wales that dated back to 1979.

He had been placed under surveillance and on bail before it was revoked at Southport Magistrates Court on Tuesday.

The court heard the man had breached his bail conditions after he accessed social media and dating sites.

Police had been monitoring his phone since June and police prosecutor senior sergeant Damian Summerfield claimed the man had access to Facebook, Instagram or Snapchat.

Defence lawyer Chris Nyst said his client had denied using social media.

Magistrate Mark Howden said the man had previously pleaded guilty to breaching bail.

'I explained in very clear terms that he was on strict bail and I explained on very clear terms he was not to access any social media platforms,'

'The defendant has allegedly ignored that condition of his bail and gone and breached it the very next day.'

authors: Aidan Wondracz For Daily Mail Australia
